locutie.beschrijving: A meditation on the majesty and 'otherness' of God through the lens of natural disasters (hurricanes, floods) and biblical responses to them.
locutie.exegetische_kwaliteit: High. Strong integration of Job's whirlwind and the Markan storm narrative, supported by literary and historical context.

illocutie.beschrijving: Primarily asserting the nature of God's power to correct sentimentalism, transitioning late into promising Christ's presence.
voorbeelden: God is the Creator of them; God is separate from them.
Jesus of Nazareth is the incarnate Creator.
Through these passages today, he speaks to you.

perlocutie.beoogd_effect: Humility, awe, and a shift from intellectual 'why' questions to trust in God's presence.
perlocutie.pneumatologisch_bewustzijn: Moderate. Mentioned as the power by which the Word is known today.

voorbeelden: The biblical testimony about storms raises all sorts of questions.
This depicts the people of God not only worshiping God...
Listen again to some of the rhetorical questions...
Look at your own stained glass.
Know this: however much the storms of this life may batter you...
I would fully expect many of you here to be shocked.
I am not suggesting that we avoid them.
I am trying to focus on just one specific facet.
He speaks to you, the living God of infinite power yet infinite mercy.
You may... put your hand in the hand of the man from Galilee.
commissieven.kwaliteit: Weakly formulated; the promise is indirect and relies on a song lyric rather than a direct 'I promise you' or 'God binds Himself'.

voorbeelden: This is what the evangelist Mark wants you to know, here, today...
declaratieven.autoriteit: Low. The preacher acts as a commentator on the text rather than a mandatory of the Word.

indicatoren: Extensive use of book reviews (McCullough, Philbrick, Larson, Melville).
Third-person historical narrative of the Johnstown flood.
Theological lecturing on the difference between God and nature.
constatief_surplus_analyse.effect_op_hoorder: The hearer becomes a spectator of theological history rather than a participant in a divine encounter.

voorbeelden: however much the storms of this life may batter you... you may... put your hand in the hand of the man from Galilee.

eerste_persoon.gebruik: Preacher as guide/analyst ('I am trying to focus').

tweede_persoon.gebruik: Direct address to the congregation ('you don't see', 'he speaks to you').
tweede_persoon.performatieve_context: Mostly used to describe the hearer's likely reaction to the information.

derde_persoon.gebruik: Dominant. Talking about Job, God, Melville, and the flood victims.

tijdloos_present.gebruik: Theological definitions ('God is separate from nature').

foutief_patroon.beschrijving: Assertive (History/Theology) -> Directive (Put your hand in the hand).
voorbeelden: The sermon explains the power of God and then tells the hearer to have humility and trust.
foutief_patroon.probleem: Lacks the middle step of the Declarative/Commissive (The Promise) that enables the Directive.

voorbeelden_slechte_verhouding: It is good for us to have humility... and it is good for us to reflect deeply.

diagnostische_evaluatie.diagnose_toelichting: The sermon functions as a brilliant theological essay or 'lyrical lecture' on the transcendence of God, but fails to transition into a sacramental event where God acts upon the hearer.

sterke_punten.tekstueel_bewijs: Analysis of Job's satisfaction vs. modern self-esteem.

zwakke_punten.tekstueel_bewijs: The sermon ends with a song quote rather than a divine word.
zwakke_punten.probleem: God remains an object of study.

diagnostische_evaluatie.gebeuren_toelichting: It is a 'talk about' God's power, not an 'exercise' of God's power.
diagnostische_evaluatie.sacramentele_toelichting: The preacher remains a narrator of others' encounters (Job, Samuel Young) rather than a mediator of a present encounter.

openbaringsleer.god_als_spreker: God is the subject of the verbs, but rarely the speaker of the sermon.
openbaringsleer.prediker_als_mandataris: Weak. Preacher acts more as a literary critic.
tekstueel_bewijs: My own study of Moby Dick has led me to...

pneumatologie.perlocutie_theologie: Implicitly left to the hearer's reflection.
tekstueel_bewijs: by the power of the living Spirit of God.

sacramentstheologie.preek_als_genademiddel: No, it is treated as a 'theme' to 'illuminate'.
tekstueel_bewijs: chosen to illuminate a particular theme.

specifieke_suggesties.huidige_formulering: Jesus of Nazareth is the incarnate Creator.
specifieke_suggesties.voorgestelde_revisie: This Jesus, who stills the storm, stands here now to still the chaos in your soul.
specifieke_suggesties.verschil: Moves from a fact about Jesus to an act of Jesus.

toezegging_versterking.probleem: The grace is hidden behind literary examples.
toezegging_versterking.suggestie: Directly apply the 'Peace! Be still!' to the congregation's specific 'hurricanes'.
voorbeeldzinnen: In the name of Christ, I declare to you: his mercy is mightier than your flood.

adressering_verbetering.suggestie: Use the second person to bridge the gap between Job's whirlwind and the hearer's life.
voorbeeldzinnen: God is not just Job's God; He is your God.

indicatief_imperatief_herstel.probleem: The imperative ('put your hand') lacks a strong performative indicative.
indicatief_imperatief_herstel.suggestie: Precede the call to trust with a declaration of God's binding promise.

aanbevelingen.slotopmerking: The sermon is intellectually stimulating and theologically sound, but it remains 'about' God. To become an 'event', the preacher must step out from behind the books and speak as God's ambassador.

comparatieve_analyse.verschil_met_schulz_von_thun: SvT would focus on the preacher's 'self-revelation' or 'relationship' with the audience; SAT reveals the lack of 'Creative Word' (Declarative).
comparatieve_analyse.verschil_met_retoriek: Rhetorically, the sermon is excellent (good metaphors, pacing); SAT reveals it is illocutionarily stagnant.
comparatieve_analyse.unieke_inzichten_SAT: SAT identifies that the 'event' is missing because the preacher is stuck in the Assertive mode (Constative Surplus).

declaratief: wants you to know (as illocutionary act of proclamation)

kernzinnen_analyse.zin: God is the Creator of them; God is separate from them.
kernzinnen_analyse.effectiviteit: High for teaching, low for encounter.

kernzinnen_analyse.zin: Jesus of Nazareth is the incarnate Creator.
He speaks to you, the living God of infinite power yet infinite mercy.
kernzinnen_analyse.effectiviteit: The strongest performative moment in the sermon.

appendices.notities: The sermon relies heavily on external authorities (authors) to carry the locutionary weight, which inadvertently weakens the preacher's own illocutionary authority as a mandatory.
